intro: Chironia stellata, commonly known as the starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its star-shaped, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Chironia stellata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
